image.altText: A hand holds an Aboriginal flag in front of a large banner

props.synopsis: South Australia's Aboriginal Affairs Minister says treaties with First Nations communities will not be concluded before the next state election, as Aboriginal leaders urge the state government to restart negotiations.

title.children: SA First Nations leaders await new treaty talks — but the government is 'not keen to rush'

image.altText: Two paramedics carry a person obscured by medical equipment on a stretcher into the back of an ambulance

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a stabbing at a CBD hotel in the early hours of Monday morning, where three men, believed to be known to each other, have been hospitalised with stab wounds.

title.children: Three men hospitalised after stabbing in Adelaide hotel

image.altText: Dead trees stick out of a lake with a grey sky.

props.synopsis: People from across the world are travelling to far west New South Wales to witness how the floodwater is changing the landscape.

title.children: Tourists and birds flock to outback Menindee Lakes as water rises

image.altText: A man wearing a green jacket and hat holding tomatoes.

props.synopsis: Tomato growers impacted by strict restrictions following the detection of a fruit virus last year say they hope they can now rebuild their lives as the government considers a relaxation of those rules.

title.children: Growers hope move to manage tomato virus will get them back to business

image.altText: a woman in a pink jumper standing in front of windows and holding on to a rail bar

props.synopsis: South Australian councils with large road networks and small populations say they're struggling to pay for much needed upgrades.

title.children: Country councils struggling with road costs want fairer funding model

image.altText: Darcy Fogarty clenches his fist in celebration

props.synopsis: Adelaide kicks 12 goals in the midst of a thumping 90-point win as Sydney's faltering season plunges to a new low at the SCG.

title.children: 'A bit of a rabble': Crows player's brutal call on faltering Swans

image.altText: A pacific gull stands on a beach as water comes around its legs.

props.synopsis: Concerns are growing for SA's endangered sea lions, prompting a call for a Coorong-based testing laboratory to ensure a "nimble" response to H5N1 bird flu's potential arrival.

title.children: Race to protect Australia's vulnerable wildlife from H5N1 bird flu

image.altText: An overhead view of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: Australia’s biggest lake is believed to have reached capacity on only three occasions in the past 160 years, but the mass of floodwater now flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is raising more than river levels.

title.children: 'Absolutely beautiful': Waters flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre a sight to behold

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of a large steel cylinder at a us steel works factory

props.synopsis: The US president tells a rally in Pennsylvania that the increase from 25 per cent to 50 per cent will "even further secure the steel industry in the United States".

title.children: Trump says he plans to double steel tariffs to 50pc

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis:
A young child has died at the scene after they were hit by a station wagon in Adelaide's northern suburbs. 

Major Crash Investigators are looking into the cause of the accident.

title.children: Young child dies after being hit by car in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A sign reading Port Augusta Prison Smoke Free Environmen outside a car park and brown building

props.synopsis:
A man accused of the murder of his wife and attempted murder of his daughter has died in the Port Augusta Prison.

The death is not suspicious and will be the subject of a coronial investigation.

title.children: Accused murderer dies in prison before scheduled court appearance

image.altText: A road closed sign in front of a street

props.synopsis: South Australian police allege a man who became unresponsive while being arrested on Thursday morning “violently resisted” police.

title.children: SA Police make new claims about arrest in Royston Park

image.altText: A wall of rocks at the shore of a thin strip of land with buildings on it, surrounded by ocean and a lagoon.

props.synopsis: New seawalls are appearing across the Pacific as sea levels rise, but climate researchers say they have a legacy of dashed hopes and unwanted side effects.

title.children: These Pacific Islands are building walls to stop rising seas. Will it work?

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge of using a Nazi symbol has been dropped against National Socialist Network leader Thomas Sewell.

title.children: Charges dropped for Nazi symbol use at Australia Day gathering

image.altText: Murray Watt walking in front of a building.

props.synopsis: Given the backlash, Labor was politically canny to postpone its Woodside decision until after the election.

title.children: If the Liberals weren't such a mess they could hold Labor to account on emissions

image.altText: Jack Ball, a 39-year-old trans man in glasses, smiles brightly in front of a photographic work, including pops of orange colour.

props.synopsis: Artist Jack Ball found transphobia, desire and care in 1950s and 70s newspapers. They turned them into the installation Heavy Grit, which just won the Ramsay Art Prize.

title.children: 'Restless, kinetic' artwork mixing photography and sculpture wins $100k

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: If it wasn't for his shock-and-awe destruction of government, Elon Musk's DOGE era might have been defined by his many MAGA feuds.

title.children: Musk winds down in Washington with new enemies in the White House

image.altText: Puffer fish Kangaroo Island

props.synopsis: Storms earlier this week could have broken up an algal bloom that has led to a huge number of marine wildlife deaths off South Australia.

title.children: Falling ocean temperatures off SA coast bring hope for end of toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Women and children carrying bottles and bags walk along a dusty road among flattened and wrecked buildings.

props.synopsis: Hamas responds to US-backed ceasefire proposals, saying it would agree to release 28 living and dead hostages, restating its demand for an end to the war and a withdrawal of Israeli troops from Gaza.

title.children: Hamas agrees to hostage releases but pushes for ceasefire 'amendments'

image.altText: damaged bus and a train carriage at the scene, after a road bridge collapsed onto railway tracks

props.synopsis: Russia's Investigative Committee, which probes serious crimes, has linked the incidents and said explicitly that both bridges were blown up.

title.children: Seven killed in bridges collapse in two Russian regions bordering Ukraine

image.altText: sprinter Lachlan Kennedy waves to the crowd after a 100 metre sprint race in nairobi

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old is the first to achieve the feat since Patrick Johnson's 9.93 Australian record in 2003.

title.children: Lachlan Kennedy first Aussie in 22 years to run 100m under 10-seconds

image.altText: Canada Wildfires (1)

props.synopsis: Provinces in Canada declare a state of emergency as fires burn through the country's interior, forcing residents to evacuate.

title.children: Thousands evacuate wildfires burning across central Canada

image.altText: A stylised graphic image shows a doctor in green scrubs looking at a hospital bed, outback scene through window

props.synopsis: The reasons abortion is still so hard for some to access are complex. But restrictions imposed at public hospitals last year have provided some clues. At its heart, this is a story about equity, dollars and political gain.

title.children: How Labor's 2019 election loss was a sliding doors moment for abortion access

image.altText: Nigeria Floods

props.synopsis: The sharp death toll rise comes as bodies are recovered nearly 10 kilometres from the epicentre of the flash flooding in north-central Nigeria.

title.children: Nigerian floods kill more than 150, as search for victims continues

image.altText: Dark silhouettes walk through red smoke that rises from several spots on the road at night.

props.synopsis: Police say the assault happened during wild scenes ahead of last night's season decider between Melbourne City and Melbourne Victory.

title.children: Police officer assaulted before A-League grand final in Melbourne

image.altText: A dark-grey two-storey concrete ruin of a hotel is nothing but a shell

props.synopsis: Once thriving with mining, farming or railways, it all came to an end in these places. Such is the history of Australia's many ghost towns.

title.children: Harsh economic realities doomed these ghost towns

image.altText: A poor quality photo of a man with a knife on an escalator, taken from above.

props.synopsis: Joel Cauchi stabbed six people dead at Westfield Bondi Junction shopping centre in 2024. For five weeks an inquest has sought to uncover shortcomings that led to that day.

title.children: How Bondi Junction killer fell through cracks in mental health system

image.altText: GettyImages-2218003277

props.synopsis: Teenager Désiré Doué stars for PSG as the French club dominates Inter Milan in the Champions League final.

title.children: With an investment in youth, PSG finally wins the Champions League

image.altText: Novak Djokovich waves to the French Open crowd

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic says he could hear when PSG scored in the Champions League as the French Open crowd followed the game on their phones.

title.children: French Open crowd cheers PSG goals, boos chair umpire during Djokovic match

image.altText: GettyImages-2217978263

props.synopsis: The recently recruited Daria Kasatkina beats Paula Badosa and ends a 37-year drought for Australia at the French Open.

title.children: Kasatkina victory ensures 37-year first for Australia at the French Open

image.altText: A worker harvests coffee beans from a plant.

props.synopsis: Farmers are teaming up with roasters and scientists to perfect the Australian coffee bean.

title.children: Can Australian coffee beans compete in an international roast?

image.altText: Obit Valerie Mahaffey

props.synopsis: Emmy award-winning actor Valeria Mahaffey, known for her roles on Desperate Housewives and Young Sheldon, has died after a battle with cancer, according to her publicist.

title.children: Desperate Housewives actor Valerie Mahaffey dies aged 71

image.altText: Richard Marles stands behind a lectern speaking into a microphone, in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: The deputy PM's comments followed assurances from US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth that the Trump administration would not abandon its allies in the Indo-Pacific to Chinese military and economic pressure.

title.children: Australia cannot  rely on US alone to counter China in the Asia-Pacific, Marles says

image.altText: Small gold nuggets.

props.synopsis: Gold prices have never been as high as they are today, and outback Queensland is set to cash in on the soaring market.

title.children: Hang on to your gold coins, as soaring prices prompt outback mining boom

image.altText: GettyImages-2217989547

props.synopsis: Australian golfer Minjee Lee gives herself a shot at making a run at the lead ahead of the final round of the US Women's Open.

title.children: Minjee Lee in with a shot as US Women's Open heads to final round
